result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of extended supervision or civil judgment.

*****8-25-14 Judge Flanagan, Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a total of 107 days of sentence credit *****
Concurrent with: to current sentence with credit for 107 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with victim, Shanese K., without prior court approval.

Successfully complete "Batterer's Intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Attend and completer parenting classes.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No srugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended  and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution Hearing scheduled on 8-14-14
**9/4/2014 set at zero

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Pierre Nicholas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Denying Motion for Sentence Credit, signed and filed.
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant's motion for sentence credit is DENIED.   mld
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.

Off the record.  Restitution Hearing was scheduled today's date in Branch 4.  The victim has not provided any restitution information to the State, per ADA Nicolas Heitman, therefore, Court ordered restitution set at zero.   mld

on Sentence Credit, signed and filed
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a total of 107 days of sentence credit.   mld

Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 The State did notify the victim for today's court date, per ADA Heitman.  The State did contact the victim, who stated that she did request restitution for the two weeks that she missed at work.  Due to the unavailability to obtain figures from the victim, adjournment of the Restitution hearing requested by the State.  Court ordered Restitution Hearing adjourned to Branch 4 on 9-4-2014 at 8:30 am.  Upon the request of defense counsel, defendant will not need to be produced for the next date.   

Court heard and granted the motion of defense that defense counsel be granted 163 days of credit for pretrial incarceration as to count #1.  mld
Original Transcript (7 pages) commencing JULY 10, 2014 SENTENCING HEARING; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.    The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Shanese K. (via telephonics) and Tiffany Nicholas. 

 AS TO AMENDED CHARGE: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS (CONCURRENT to current sentence), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Shanese K., 
   without prior court approval.  
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution Hearing scheduled in Branch 4 on 8-14-2014 at 8:30 am.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
 Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.   
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.   mld

Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge to Substantial Battery Intend Bodily Harm (Domestic Abuse), Wis. Stats 940.19(2) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class I Felony."   mld

Attorney Eugene J Dietzler in court, defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Status Conference held off the record.  Defendant was not produced from Dodge Correctional.  Defense counsel advised that the defendant is incarcerated under the name of Demarcus Johnson.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-10-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in court with attorney Eric D Lowenberg.  Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 04.  Hearing on motion to withdraw proceeds.  Statements by defendant.  Court grants motion and allows Attorney Lowenberg to withdraw subject to new counsel being appointed.   Court cancels the 6-10-14 date.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  MARCH 3, 2014 received and filed. (18 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Anne Devitt - SPD  819 N 6th Street  9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203

Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Ronald Edwards.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied.   Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery and an offer from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-31-2014 at 1:30 pm.  No contact order is continued in full force, per the Court.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shaness K

Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Anthony Pierre Nicholas in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
